alert.note: Alert for Grundy (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 17 at 10:50AM CST until February 18 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Chicago has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Illinois... Mazon River near Coal City affecting Grundy County. For the Mazon River...including Coal City...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding caused by rain and snowmelt is expected. * WHERE...Mazon River from IL-113 west of Coal City downstream to confluence with Illinois River, including the Coal City gauge. * WHEN...Until tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, minor flooding of low lying areas downstream near the Illinois River will occur. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:45 AM CST Thursday the stage was 6.3 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to near 11.0 feet tonight. The river is expected to begin falling by the weekend. Some fluctuation in water levels is possible due to river ice. - Action stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: These forecasts are based on observed precipitation as well as forecast precipitation 48 hours into the future. Changes to the rainfall forecast, or any additional rainfall after 48 hours, may cause changes to these river forecasts. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/Chicago and water.weather.gov The next statement is expected tonight.
